0.title: CPU usage

1.title: Memory usage
1.query:
timeseries { 
	usage = avg(system.memory.usage, 
	filter: { (host.name == $Hosts) AND ((state == "used")  OR (state == "buffered")) }), 
	limit = max(system.memory.limit, filter: { host.name == $Hosts }) }, by: { host.name }, 
	union: true
| sort arrayAvg(usage) desc
| limit 1
| fieldsAdd MemoryUtilization = arrayLast(usage) / arrayLast(limit) * 100

2.title: Network IO
2.query:
timeseries avg(system.network.io), by: { host.name }, filter: { matchesValue(host.name, $Hosts) }
| fieldsAdd NetworkIO = arrayAvg(`avg(system.network.io)`)

3.title: Filesystem usage

5.title: CPU usage per process
5.query:
timeseries utilization = avg(process.cpu.utilization), by: { process.command_line, host.name }, filter: { host.name == $Hosts }
| fieldsAdd utilization = arrayMax(utilization) * 100
| sort utilization desc
| fieldsRemove interval, timeframe, host.name

6.title: OS Type

7.title: Memory usage per process
7.query:
timeseries utilization = avg(process.memory.utilization), by: { process.command_line, host.name }, filter: { host.name == $Hosts }
| fieldsAdd utilization = arrayAvg(utilization)
| sort utilization desc
| fieldsRemove interval, timeframe, host.name

8.title: Memory

11.title: Paging usage

13.title: Logical CPU

14.title: OS Arch

15.title: Memory

16.title: Filesystem capacity

18.title: Physical CPUs

19.content:
# OpenTelemetry Host Dashboard

Follow the Dynatrace Documentation how to configure the Hostmetrics receiver and [allowed metric attributes](/ui/apps/dynatrace.classic.settings/ui/settings/builtin:opentelemetry-metrics?gtf=-2h&gf=all) on your Dynatrace Tenant. Note that the dashboard won't include any alerts by default. To configure alerts, use [Davis Anomaly Detection](/ui/apps/dynatrace.davis.anomalydetection/).

---
